alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 16 at 3:20AM MST until March 16 at 2:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Arizona... Verde River above Clarkdale affecting Yavapai County. For the Verde River near Clarkdale...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and is forecast to continue. * WHERE...Verde River above Clarkdale. * WHEN...Until this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, High flow could lead to bank erosion and water ponding in backwater catch basins. At 12.0 feet, Nuisance flooding of property along riverbanks. At 15.0 feet, Inundation of homes along Bates Road and Rio Verde RV park in Cottonwood begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 AM MST Thursday the stage was 14.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:00 AM MST Thursday was 15.7 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate above flood stage with a maximum value of 14.0 feet early this morning. It will fall below flood stage later this morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.0 feet on 08/01/2010. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety. && Fld Observed Forecasts (3 am MST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Verde River Clarkdale 12.0 14.0 Thu 3 am MST 7.8 4.3 3.1 &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at: http://ahps2.wrh.noaa.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=fgz
